gameEngine

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • gameEngine.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public abstract class World
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane

    A World is an extension of a Pane that holds Actors (which are custom ImageView objects). Since a World is a Pane it already keeps track of its children Nodes and this list can be accessed via a call to the Pane's getChildren().

    A World contains an AnimationTimer which runs on its own act() method as well as the act() method for every Actor in the World.

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World()
        Creates a new World and starts the AnimationTimer for the world. This is a default World, meaning there are no Actors in it.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the AnimationTimer.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the AnimationTimer.

      • add

        public void add(Actor actor)
        Adds the given Actor to the world.
        Parameters:
        actor - the actor to be added.

      • remove

        public void remove(Actor actor)
        Removes the given Actor from the world.
        Parameters:
        actor - the actor to be removed.

      • getObjects

        public <A extends Actor> java.util.List<A> getObjects(java.lang.Class<A> cls)
        Returns a list of all the Actors in the world of the given class.
        Parameters:
        cls - the specified class to be searched.
        Returns:
        a List of all actors to be removed.

      • act

        public abstract void act(long now)
        This method is called every frame once start has been called.
        Parameters:
        now - the current time in nanoseconds
